Ocho Dos Dos is an oak-aged red wine that embodies the essence of the Ribera del Duero D.O. Produced by the prestigious Pagos de Anguix Winery, Ocho Dos Dos is a winemaking gem that invites you on a Journey of flavors and sensations. It presents a red wine made from 100% Tempranillo grapes, reflecting the authenticity of this winemaking region.  | Spain

• Color: Bright straw yellow, clean and luminous.
• Nose: Complex and expressive — ripe stone fruits (peach, apricot), citrus (lemon zest), floral hints (lily), plus a distinct salty, mineral Atlantic character. Some vintages may show light toasty or yeasty aromas from lees aging.
• Palate: Fresh and vibrant, with a creamy texture from the lees contact. Flavors of nectarine, melon, lime, and hints of almond and fennel. Long, slightly saline finish.

 | Albariño

• Color: Garnet to cherry-red with medium intensity  .
• Aromas: Wild/ripe red berries (strawberry, raspberry, blackberry), smoky, balsamic, spicy, with earthy/mineral nuances—sometimes graphite or smoked meat  .
• Palate: Round, well-balanced tannins, fresh acidity, medium-full body. Flavors echo red fruit, oak-derived spices, and slate minerality, delivering a long finish  .

 | Ribera Sarca
